about.description:
zfp is an open source C/C++ library for compressed numerical arrays
that support high throughput read and write random access. zfp also
supports streaming compression of integer and floating-point data,
e.g., for applications that read and write large data sets to and
from disk. zfp is primarily written in C and C++ but also includes
Python and Fortran bindings.
about.summary: Library for compressed numerical arrays that support high throughput read and write random access

name: zfpy
raw_recipe:

  patches:

  sha256: fe13b03141ee9b571692aed42ff76cf37c9dcda40f9a43a808870dca3558a57c
  url: https://github.com/LLNL/zfp/archive/1.0.0.tar.gz
build:
  number: 2

  string: py37hbc43c61_2
requirements:

    - libcxx 14.0.6 hccf4f1f_0
    - libffi 3.4.2 h0d85af4_5
    - libgfortran 5.0.0 10_4_0_h97931a8_25

    - ncurses 6.3 h96cf925_1
    - numpy 1.19.5 py37hdb226fd_3
    - openssl 3.0.5 hfd90126_2
    - python 3.7.12 hf3644f1_100_cpython
    - python_abi 3.7 2_cp37m

about:
  description: 'zfp is an open source C/C++ library for compressed numerical arrays

    that support high throughput read and write random access. zfp also

    supports streaming compression of integer and floating-point data,

    e.g., for applications that read and write large data sets to and

    from disk. zfp is primarily written in C and C++ but also includes

    Python and Fortran bindings.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/LLNL/zfp
  doc_url: https://zfp.readthedocs.io/
  home: https://zfp.llnl.gov
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Library for compressed numerical arrays that support high throughput read
    and write random access
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - GarrettDMorrison
    - ToreAad
    - hmaarrfk
    - kmpaul
    - lindstro
